results.title: Young Einstein (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Yahoo Serious, David Roach, Warwick Ross and Serious Productions
results.brief_description: A comedy based on the premise that Albert Einstein not only developed the theory of relativity but also invented rock ‘n roll. Albert Einstein sails the world, falls in love with the world’s most intelligent and beautiful girl, Marie Curie, creates the first surfboard, invents the electric guitar and uses rock ‘n roll to save the planet from atomic destruction. Virtually a one-man tour de force by Yahoo Serious and co-starring Odile le Clezio.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Yahoo Serious, David Roach, Warwick Ross and Serious Productions

constellations_other.name: Great southern land?
constellations_other.description: Australia is often mythologised in film and TV, but national myths must not only be embraced, but resisted.

results.title: Vietnam: The Ten Thousand Day War. - Volume 1.
results.creator_credit: Don North, Paul Lang, Ron Kelly, Ian Macleod, Cinequity Funding and Information Television Productions
results.brief_description: Known as history’s first ‘living room war’, the Vietnam conflict is presented here with clarity, authority and insight. Written by Pulitzer Prize winner, Peter Arnett, and narrated by Richard Basehart, it’s seen through the eyes of key policymakers and fighting soldiers. The interviews, film clips, and commentary put this ‘police action’ into an illuminating perspective. “America in Vietnam” - gives an overall perspective of the shifting attitudes of the United States towards Vietnam, from the early liaison to the ultimate fall of Saigon. “Dien Bien Phu” - examines the French surrender at this crucial battle, and how it triggered 20 years of direct American involvement in Vietnam.

results.title: Vietnam: the long road home
results.creator_credit: Peter Corbett, Portland Arts Advisory Board, Film Victoria and Powerhouse
results.brief_description: This film, produced by a Vietnam war veteran, tells the story of ordinary Australians in the Vietnam war mainly from the point of view of conscripts, Channel 9 camera man Reg Boulter, a doctor, Michael Martin and two former political antagonists, Malcolm Fraser and Jim Cairns.

results.title: Vietnam, Australia's war
results.creator_credit: Michael Phillips, Joseph Matthews and Number One
results.brief_description: Examines Australia’s involvement in the Vietnam Conflict, 1962-72 using archival footage, stills, maps, home movies and newspaper headlines. Presents a chronological sequence of events during this period and queries Australia’s involvement. Addresses the long-term health and emotional effects of the conflict on veterans and their families.

results.title: Vidocq et les Faux Temoins = Vidocq and the False Witnesses
results.brief_description:
Vidocq is attempting to locate, Grouard, part antique dealer, part fence, who got him convicted a few years earlier thanks to a false testimony.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Gabriel Gobin, Fernand Berset.

results.title: Videogames and Us
results.brief_description: Since videogames were first invented in laboratories, our relationship to play has evolved. From arcades and the first home consoles to today’s blockbuster releases, mobile games and experimental indies, how we interpret and experience vieogames has changed alongside us.

constellations_primary.name: Arcades and AI
constellations_primary.description: Using the godfather of computing, Alan Turing, as a starting point, this Constellation traces the evolution of AI representation on-screen and the way female androids, robots and holograms have been hyper sexualised.

results.description: Play is an essential part of who we are as individuals and as a collective. Since videogames were first invented by scientists in laboratories, our relationship to play has come a long way. From arcades and the first home consoles to today’s blockbuster releases, mobile games and experimental indies, videogames have evolved dramatically and so have we. How we interpret and experience videogames, and the communities and cultures spawned from them, reveals much about how society has shifted in the past five decades.

results.title: Vidocq a Bicetre = Vidocq in Bicetre Prison
results.brief_description:
Vidocq is doing an other stint in prison, just time enough to organise his next escape via the asylum section. While Annette waits anxiously with a carriage outside the prison, Vidocq and friend are held captive by the lunatics. Convinced the two intruders are demons, the asylum patients decide to put the men on trial.

Credits: Producer, Etienne Laroche ; director, Claude Loursais ; writer, Georges Neveux ; photography, Maurice Damien ; music, Serge Gainsbourg.
Cast: Bernard Noel, Alain Mottet, Genevieve Fontanel, Helene Dieudonne, Serge Gainsbourg.

results.title: How to cope with stress = coping with stress
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Video Therapy with Alf Fowles”.
Stress is a normal, everyday part of life. People have different stress thresholds and individuals react to identical stressors to different degrees. British therapist, Alf Fowles, editor of the magazine “Natural Medicine”, explains how stress can affect our lives outlining the warning signs of possible mental breakdown and gives ten coping strategies. A simple self hypnosis technique to reduce stress is demonstrated at the conclusion of the program.
